definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Guangwu deep appreciation and gratuities three hundred thousand.
sentences.chinese: 光武帝深表讚賞，又賞錢三十萬。

sentences.english: When they heard what he had come for, they were greatly pleased, and promised him money;
sentences.chinese: 聽到他的來意後，他們非常高興，答應給他賞錢。

sentences.english: But why do people tip taxi drivers they are never going to see again, or leave gratuities in restaurants in cities they rarely visit?
sentences.chinese: 同時又爲什麼要在難得踏足的城市，給餐廳留下賞錢？

sentences.english: It is customary to give something to the porter.
sentences.chinese: 給搬行李的服務員一點兒賞錢是個慣例。

sentences.english: Uncle Ke-ting and his friends enjoyed themselves, and the dragon dancers got their money.
sentences.chinese: 五舅他們得到了滿足，玩龍燈的人得到了賞錢。

definition: to hog/to keep everything for oneself
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
dichlorvos C4H7Cl2PO4, organic phosphate used as insecticide (loanword)/also called dimethyl dichloro-vinyl phosphate DDVP
